node host's various resources. The to-be weighed resources and their

the API request as the followings:

        'weighed_resources': ['name1', 'name2']

subject: Rework deletion of insecure users
commit_message:
Rework deletion of insecure users

Due to a bug in MySQL [1] -- or possibly the Ubuntu MySQL server
packages -- issuing a call to DROP USER fails consistently when
provisioning a node with the recipes/mysql-server.rb recipe.

This reworks the DROP USER to a DELETE call on the mysql.user
table. Note that the DROP USER is preferred over the call to
manually DELETE FROM mysql.user because Galera cluster does not
replicate DELETE events on MyISAM tables but does replicate
DROP USER events [2]. So, when the MySQL bug is fixed or a
workaround is found, we should revert this patch.

[1] http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=69644
[2] http://www.codership.com/wiki/doku.php?id=limitations

has a many-to-many relationship. One or more service instances
coordinate between each other to conduct actions on a set of nodes,
using guarded locks to prevent conflicting simultaneous actions on any
given node. The old name "manager" suggested a more one-to-many relationship,
which is not the design pattern which we use here.

blueprint support-for-multipart-form-data-contenttype

Changes the upload path to handle form content versus a straight
file post as well as size (some browsers won't push the size of the
file, and it wouldn't match the content-length because the form data
contains more than the file contents).

A util was added to parse out the form parts into "headers" as they
would be in a regular POST.

The deserializer was modified to co-opt the deserialization code path
if there is a multipart form submittal otherwise it puts the daemon
back on the old deserialize path

The size in the content length header is adjusted for form submittals
size the actual content length is greater than the image size.  Because
some browsers are not cooperative around reporting sizes, the code was
made to go through a series of heuristics to devine the size of the image
passed across the network.

the cgi.FieldStorage will leak file handles (that you can't see because
FieldStorage unlinks them) without a change to the
implementation of FieldStorage (i.e., via monkey patch - or changes to
wsgi/webob) this should be filed as a bug and the community should decide
what to do.  The monkey patch is very simple....here's the proposed code:

def create_FieldStorage_make_file_monkey_patch(dir=None):
    """
    Generates a function to monkey patch FieldStorage's make_file
    with one that's a bit more flexible.
    """
    def FieldStorage_make_file_monkey_patch(self, binary=False):
        """
        Creates a tempfile in a predefined
        """
        if dir != None:
            t = tempfile.TemporaryFile("w+b", dir=dir)
        else:
            t = tempfile.TemporaryFile("w+b")

        return t

    return FieldStorage_make_file_monkey_patch

Then add the following lines in __init__ for the api controller

        #Monkey Patch cgi.FieldStorage.make_file
        cgi.FieldStorage.__dict__['make_file'] = \
            create_FieldStorage_make_file_monkey_patch(
                self.conf.temp_upload_dir )

subject: Switch to ini_setting for managing tempest.conf.
commit_message:
Switch to ini_setting for managing tempest.conf.

 * The previous way of customizing tempest.conf was problematic
   for a number of reasons:

   - default values were being defined in the manifest and those
     values differed from the defaults in tempest.conf.sample.
     Defaults should be the province of the tempest maintainers,
     not the puppet module.
   - the use of templating meant that extra work would have to be
     expended maintaining the templates, not only for releases
     but also for the upstream master.

 * This changeset switches to using ini_setting to ensure that:

   - individual configuration settings can be set ad hoc, and
     the upstream defaults will be left alone if no value is provided.
   - tempest.conf can be sourced from the tempest repo sample rather
     than having to be maintained in the module.

 * Other included fixes:

   - removing unused glance uri configuration
   - consolidating the identity uri parameters into a single parameter,
     since that is how it is represented in tempest.conf
